description.value: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

The githyanki makes two greatsword attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 2d6 type=psychic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting (Psionics). The githyanki’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[int]{Intelligence}. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

At will: mage hand (the hand is &Reference[invisible]{invisible})

3/day each: jump, misty step, nondetection (self only)

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Special Notes: the hand is invisible.

A spectral, floating hand appears at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

You can use your action to control the hand. You can use the hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.
You touch a creature. The creature's jump distance is tripled until the spell ends.
Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

Special Notes: self only.

For the duration, you hide a target that you touch from &Reference[div]{divination} magic. The target can be a willing creature or a place or an object no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. The target can't be targeted by any &Reference[div]{divination} magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.
